timeline.message:

Fixed build issue

removed index for foreign keys

removed index for foreign keys as it will be generated by default

timeline.bodyText: unique should be false by default, no need to add here.
timeline.author: zohrehj

timeline.bodyText: custom_app_id has unique=true annotation, it should have an automatically generated unique index.
timeline.author: zohrehj

replies.author: dhanyak-btc

timeline.bodyText:
user_id should have an automatic index, if joincolumn is used.
for other fields, please provide the query to verify what is the best index we can create; i.e. would it be better to have a multicolumn one, or individual columns.
timeline.author: zohrehj

replies.bodyText:
@Kantharajut-btc please remove index for column user_id
UNIQUE KEY `user_details_user_id_app_info_id_uidx` (`user_id`,`app_info_id`),
 KEY `user_details_email_idx` (`email`),
 KEY `user_details_user_id_idx` (`user_id`),
 KEY `user_details_last_name_idx` (`last_name`),
 KEY `FKo905twpc0drywmf4x5e0io0cn` (`app_info_id`),
replies.author: dhanyak-btc

timeline.bodyText: why do we need an index for last_name?
timeline.author: zohrehj
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -52,6 +53,11 @@
       @UniqueConstraint(
           columnNames = {"user_id", "app_info_id"},
           name = "user_details_user_id_app_info_id_uidx")
+    },
+    indexes = {
+      @Index(name = "user_details_email_idx", columnList = "email"),
+      @Index(name = "user_details_user_id_idx", columnList = "user_id"),
+      @Index(name = "user_details_last_name_idx", columnList = "last_name")

replies.bodyText: we were fetching the data based on last_name in one of the  test case , hence removed
replies.author: Kantharajut-btc

timeline.bodyText:
same here, columns with unique or joinColumn notation, most likely don't need an index.
For other values, document the query that needs the index so that we can confirm what index is best suitable for query.
timeline.author: zohrehj

timeline.message:
Fixed PR comments

Fixed PR comment

Fixed PR comment

timeline.bodyText:
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/10524651/is-there-any-performance-gain-in-indexing-a-boolean-field
No need to index a column that only has a few values, even with index in worst case you would need to iterate through 1/3 of the table, and index has storage and performance costs as well.
timeline.author: zohrehj

timeline.bodyText: what is the query that uses this index?
timeline.author: zohrehj

replies.author: Kantharajut-btc

replies.bodyText: both these queries are filtering on site_id, and then status; since site_id does not have an index, let's make this into a composite index for both columns instead.
replies.author: zohrehj
